title: Given a 14-day suspension for first time offence?
body:
Recently played a game as Zac on our team we  had a yorick top lane begging me for ganks, i was trying to help him out but he kept on blaming me for losing lane Pinging missing on me after trying to go in etc. I was never given a penalty before this one and honestly was never this toxic before however I was given a 14 day suspension skipping 10 games and 25 games chat restriction. 
Here is the chat log: 
Game 1:
Reksu: want me to cum?
Reksu: hold on
Reksu: I WAS GETTING ULT
Reksu: salty boi
Reksu: dont tell the jungler what to do %%%got
Reksu: get good
Reksu: dont blame me
Reksu: im trying to babysit top
Reksu: NICE
Reksu: YOU ARE A GOD
Reksu: ekko nice job popping off
Reksu: yorick stop being a %%%got
Reksu: gg
I have to say i was being extremely toxic but a 14 day suspension is too harsh in my opinion for a first time offence. I even bought RP as soon as i got banned.

replies.body:
Hate speech is zero tolerance and is an immediate 14 day suspension.

Be careful as even slight toxicity after your ban will result in a permanent suspension.
Oh dident know that ;-; thanks for the info

Considering riot has said multiple times, they dont accept hate speech at all, and will escalate to a ban, yea this is a fair punishment.
> [{quoted}](name=Reksu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kd7Hk8zZ,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-12-29T05:00:37.358+0000)
>

> Reksu: yorick stop being a %%%got

Now that I think about its hate speech because %%%g0t is a homophobic word. It's just like the n word or the k word for Jews. Maybe if you used a different word it would've been a warning or a chat ban. Other than that, yes you deserved it. Tbh, about your punishment, I thought it was one or the other and not a chat ban.
yeah it was totally my fault, its funny because im not even homophobic i was just mad and said it so say it. im dumb

From what I've seen, that is actually the case with most of the people who use the homophobic slurs.  They aren't actually trying to attack someone's sexuality, but they are using them as an insult, and Riot still doesn't want the words to be used so flippantly.  

Just be aware that your account is on very thin ice at the moment.  Any further rule breaking, ANY AT ALL, will result in a permaban.  It doesn't have to be something big.  It doesn't have to be more hate speech.  Any toxicity, if reported, can get you banned.  If you have a tendency to lash out at teammates when they are bothering you, you might want to consider muting them at the beginning of the match, or muting their pings.  You cannot be banned for saying toxic things if you never say anything toxic.
